description:
Where do Linux and Rust go from here? A roundtable of kernel developers share their thoughts.

The post Rust in Linux Now: Progress, Pitfalls, and Why Devs and Maintainers Need Each Other appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Rust in Linux Now: Progress, Pitfalls, and Why Devs and Maintainers Need Each Other

description:
Manjaro 24.1 “Xahea” is now available, featuring KDE Plasma 6.1.5, GNOME 46, and the latest kernel enhancements.

The post Manjaro 24.1 “Xahea” Released, Here’s What’s New appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Manjaro 24.1 “Xahea” Released, Here’s What’s New

description:
The HardenedBSD Foundation has partnered with Protectli, a manufacturer of open-source firewall appliances, to develop a censorship- and surveillance-resistant mesh network.

The post HardenedBSD and Protectli Partner to Build a Censorship-Resistant Mesh Network appeared first on Linux Today.
title: HardenedBSD and Protectli Partner to Build a Censorship-Resistant Mesh Network

description:
FFmpeg 7.1 “Peter” debuts with full Vulkan encoding pipelines, enhanced AAC decoding, MV-HEVC support, and more. Here’s what’s new!

The post FFmpeg 7.1 Promises Major Improvements in Video Processing appeared first on Linux Today.
title: FFmpeg 7.1 Promises Major Improvements in Video Processing

description:
Reor is a private AI personal knowledge management tool. Think of it as a notes program on steroids. Each note is saved as a Markdown file to a “vault” directory on your machine.

The post Machine Learning in Linux: Reor – AI note-taking app appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Machine Learning in Linux: Reor – AI note-taking app

description:
Audacious 4.4.1 is here three and a half months after Audacious 4.4, a major release that added a Background Music plugin to make sound equally loud within and between tracks, re-introduced the Lyrics plugin for the GTK interface, added Disc Number support, and support for a linear volume scale for PipeWire.

The post Audacious 4.4.1 Open-Source Audio Player Brings New Features and Improvements appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Audacious 4.4.1 Open-Source Audio Player Brings New Features and Improvements

description:
Here’s our September 2024 updates to the largest compilation of recommended free and open source software available for Linux.

The post Best Free and Open Source Software: September 2024 Updates appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Best Free and Open Source Software: September 2024 Updates

description:
Rspamd 3.10 spam filtering system brings enhanced MIME UTF8 support and negative score limits for improved email scanning.

The post Rspamd 3.10 Released with Enhanced MIME UTF8 Support appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Rspamd 3.10 Released with Enhanced MIME UTF8 Support

description:
Online educators are spoilt for choice if they decide to share their knowledge through an e-learning platform on Linux. Today there is a great number of learning management systems (LMS) that can be easily adapted to the needs of both teachers and students to make the online educational process as smooth and productive as possible. […]

The post How to Create Fillable Forms in Moodle with ONLYOFFICE Docs appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Create Fillable Forms in Moodle with ONLYOFFICE Docs

description:
Learn how to use the XXD command to manage, convert, and display binary data from standard input or file on Unix and Linux.

The post How to Use XXD Command in Linux: A Step-by-Step Guide appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Use XXD Command in Linux: A Step-by-Step Guide

description:
This article provides you with several effective ways to read large files and extract the necessary information on Linux.

The post How to Read Large Files on Linux With Ease appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Read Large Files on Linux With Ease

description:
In this article, you’ll learn how to install the Deluge BitTorrent client on Ubuntu and other Linux distros, how to use it, and then how to remove it.

The post Install Deluge BitTorrent Client on Ubuntu & Other Linux Distros appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Install Deluge BitTorrent Client on Ubuntu & Other Linux Distros

description:
Firefox 132 is another boring release that adds support for blocking third-party cookie access with Enhanced Tracking Protection’s Strict mode, support for blocking HTTP-favicons if they aren’t served over HTTPS, and enabling WebRender hardware accelerated rendering for most SVG Filter Primitives to improve the performance of certain graphics-heavy content.

The post Firefox 132 Enters Beta with Support for Blocking Third-Party Cookie Access appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Firefox 132 Enters Beta with Support for Blocking Third-Party Cookie Access

description:
Slated for release in December 2024, near the Christmas holidays, Linux Mint 22.1 will ship with the soon-to-be-released Cinnamon 6.4 desktop environment featuring a revamped theme that’s much darker and contrasted than before, rounded elements, redesigned dialogs, and a gap between the applets and the panel.

The post Linux Mint 22.1 Slated for Release in December with Revamped Cinnamon Theme appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Linux Mint 22.1 Slated for Release in December with Revamped Cinnamon Theme
